page.title: 09LAUGHARNE'S LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: Laugharne has four tiers of Local Government; Dyfed County Council (1 Ind. Councillor living in St Clears); Carmarthen District Council (2 Ind. Councillors living in Laugharne); Laugharne Town Council (formerly Community Council) with a Mayor and 13 Councillors and Laugharne Corporation (with a Portreeve and Grand Jury of 20 men) containing 460 Burgesses. The land and property of the Corporation is administered at fortnightly meet- ings (Court Baron). Annual election of Officers in Oct at 'Big Court'. On official duties the Portreeve wears the gold cockle-shells chain of office symbolising Laugharne's industry, and a maroon robe. Every three years Corporation officials and townspeople beat the bounds of their land on the 22 mile Common Walk.
